title: illoai

replies.body: Illoai? almost as good as illinois

I don't think she needs nerfs, she is just really strong in some areas, and is really weak in some areas.

If you have a problem with her, play something like quinn, or gnar with frozen mallet, and focus on whittling her down in lane. She can't chase you, and she only is strong when you engage on her.

In team fights, just kite back when she ults, because she is useless outside of tentacle range.
feel free to comment negatively maybe I am wrong.

> feel free to comment negatively maybe I am wrong.

I will admit that Illaoi is powerful as a juggernaut, one of the critical issues i feel myself is the fact that once again as i've ranted a dozen times in other threads: "She's a champion who can exploit the hell out of the tank meta style that alot of champions, even the non'tanks can make use of."

Seriously, Compare an Illaoi who rushes Deadman's plate to one who rushes something else first. More then likely your going to see her snowball spam her Q and wave clear with ease, use that mobility to gap close you enough to E grab you and then beat the crap out of you to where your zoned, turret hugging or pretty much dead if she manages to get another E off of you or make use of that mobility to get close enough for a hard to escape Q, especially if you do not have boots to mitigate the mobility gap, when her tentacles made from her passive and her Q which also gains that slam damage bonus, can already turn into enough of a bother.

If Deadman's plate was removed from the game, i would not be amazed if we see a sharp decrease in tank or tank/fighter champion mixes viability without that +60 move speed bonus which trumps so many other mobility items and grants 'sustainability' against AD champions and plenty of hp to soak hits with much more ease. Sadly we can't get that case yet, but at the very least the bonus move might as well be capped to +30 to make it more in line with other mobility items or make it where the mobility can't be constantly sustained especially when you aren't auto attacking anything for the majority of the time, probably creating more measures then just roots and slows to make stacks decline (such as maybe needing to be in combat for the stacks to build to also reduce its ability to roam around fast and get back to your outter'most turret as if you were TPing to it).
